text: how do you make this wonderful
restaurant style creme brulee at home
well it's easier than you think
and it really only takes five
ingredients to make I'm going to start
with heavy cream and that is the cr√®me
in creme brulee so I have four cups
which is one quart of heavy cream pour
that into a small saucepan and heat this
over medium-low heat and to this add one
vanilla bean and the vanilla bean is
what really what gives the creme brulee
it's wonderful flavor you could also use
vanilla extract in place of one whole
bean with the seeds I would say a
teaspoon to a teaspoon and a half of
vanilla extract would be just fine and
what I'm doing is just letting the pod
down the center taking the back of my
knife and scraping up all of those
millions of seeds and that goes right
into the pot with this cream and you're
going to bring this up to a simmer you
really just want to infuse the cream
with the vanilla flavor and now for a
third ingredient sugar in total for this
recipe you will need 3/4 of a cup of
granulated sugar you need that divided
in half so I'm going to take half of
that and sprinkle it in here with the
cream heat this up dissolve the sugar
flavor the cream and while this is
heating I'm going to work on ingredient
number four seven egg yolks and to that
I'm going to add the other half of the
sugar and a pinch of salt whisk this
together and you never want to do this
too far in advance whisking egg yolks
with sugar what can happen is if it sits
for too long the sugar can burn the egg
yolks and what that does is it creates
little lumpy clumps of egg yolk so you
don't want to do this step too far in
advance so our infused cream mixture is
nice and hot you don't want to bring it
up to a boil because what that will do
is it will break the cream so take a
ladle full and what we're going to do
now is temper the egg yolks and that
means bring the yolks up to the
temperature of the cream if you poured
all of this in it once what would happen
is you'd basically scramble your egg
yolk
you don't want that to happen so you're
going to gradually do this so I'm going
to ladle in my cream and then whisk this
quickly together bringing those egg
yolks up to temperature and now the rest
of the cream once this is whisk together
strain it through a fine mesh sieve just
to pull out the vanilla bean if there's
any little bits of egg yolk to bake the
custards I have 8 5 ounce ramekins just
fill your ramekins up I would leave
maybe a quarter of an inch make sure
your oven is preheated to 300 degrees
and also you're going to need a tea
kettle or a pot of boiling water because
whenever you're cooking custards it's
really best to cook them in a water bath
what that does is it cooks the custard
more gently giving you a nice silky
texture to your custard I'm going to go
right to the oven with these middle rack
of your oven it's best to fill with hot
water when the pan is in your oven so
that you don't spill 30 to 40 minutes
until the custards jiggles slightly in
the center when they come out of the
oven what you want to do is you want to
remove the ramekins from the water bath
that they're baking in onto a wire rack
to cool for about 30 minutes maybe up to
an hour before wrapping with plastic
wrap and refrigerate overnight so that's
what I have here and now the fun part is
creating that crunchy sugary caramelized
top so all you need is a little bit more
granulated sugar about a tablespoon and
a half place it on and then rotate and
tap the ramekin to spread out the sugar
in a nice even layer now you can brulee
the top in two different ways
if you have one of these kitchen torches
at home or if you have something in your
garage you can certainly use this or you
could do this under the broiler I prefer
using a kitchen torch because you're not
heating up the entire custard by putting
it into the oven so hold the torch about
six inches away from the top of the
custard gradually melting the sugar
and caramelizing the sugar evenly if you
go too close to the custard you're going
to get burnt spots around you can see
the sugar starts dancing and melting so
this looks good to me now let it cool so
that all of those hot sugars can set up
and become crunchy and there you go five
ingredients you'll be making creme
brulee at home any night of the week
enjoy guys
you
